div.p: From Theodore Bevan to Edward Strickland
A 38, letter book, The Royal Geographical Society of Australasia Victorian Branch, Mitchell Library, State Library of New South Wales, Sydney.

Provide context.
Herewith I return Baron Von M's letter to yourself which you were kind enough to show me.

The point is this that the Council of the R.G.S. in Melbourne following your kind example passed a resolution to the effect that a reward should be granted to Mr Bevan also adding & "
party ": and "to Mr Bevan and his companions ."

Now if you are writing the Baron I should esteem it a favour if you would kindly point out to him that although I should be glad to see all the 30 whites & blacks who have been exmployed by me on my last two expeditions rewarded in addition to the fairly liberal salaries which they were paid — yet it would be impossible to get at them for the purpose: as we do not even know their addresses: also that putting such a difficulty in the way of the Imperial authorities is likely to prevent such recommendation having any useful result towards myself.
